messages: 57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (19:08): hello, anyone familiar with syntax highlighting for php with vim 6.2 over secureCRT?
57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (19:10): i mean vim 6.3
57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (19:12): actually.. let me be more specific, when editing php files.. for every variable '$varname' the dollar sign and first character of the varible are highlighted
57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (19:12): can this be fixed
b3c39cf5a1bb7db1ec7704d416d21011 (19:12): :set syntax=php
57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (19:13): awesome.. thank you
b3c39cf5a1bb7db1ec7704d416d21011 (19:13): for some reason it does not detect the filetype correctly
57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (19:18): is that a problem with 6.3?  cause im not specifying anything for filetypes in .vimrc
57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (19:41): i'm trying to set snytax type to php in .vimrc but it doesn't seeme to stick, doing :set syntax=php works in editor
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:43): why would you set that in your vimrc? do you only edit php files in Vim?
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:43): use "filetype on" instead. that enables Vim's filetype detection
fa92dbf68a4d779204a8f09d9af0b7ff (19:43): I was about to say that.
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:43): and "syntax on" to enable syntax highlighting
57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (19:44): i know putting it in .vimrc isn't the best idea
57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (19:45): well.. i just realized something.. the file names are .module, would that cause a problem?
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:47): no, just use one of the methods in ":he new-filetype" to recognize those as php
57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (19:50): oh.. i thought i was substituting 'module' for new-filetype
2fbed88812de659619e4dc10463e3a44 (19:56): how can i delete lines starting with blabla?
2fbed88812de659619e4dc10463e3a44 (19:56): s/blalalblalb//g onlz deletes the word not the line
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (19:56): Yes.. read the help page I suggested.
2fbed88812de659619e4dc10463e3a44 (19:59): doesnt help me or im too stupid
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (19:59): I think it helps you exactly...
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (20:00): :g/somepattern/commandtorunonlinesmatchingthatpattern
2fbed88812de659619e4dc10463e3a44 (20:00): whats the delete command, d?
2fbed88812de659619e4dc10463e3a44 (20:01): ok thanks, i tried %gs/dfsdfsd//g
cc8f779200b7979930492b9c15de74f7 (20:01): mhmm... i do my latex-beamer-slides with vim. therefore I want to have a abbrevation for this frame-stuff. so I have a entry in my .vimrc like this:
cc8f779200b7979930492b9c15de74f7 (20:02): iab Yframe  <CR>\frame{<CR><C-U><CR>\frametitle{}<CR>}<CR><C-R>=Eatchar('\s')<CR>
cc8f779200b7979930492b9c15de74f7 (20:02): and this nearly works perfect. just one more feature: how do I set the cursor (in insert-modus) after the open brackets after frametitle?
57fdbc9d4eb5f02adf0633872c87272f (20:10): thanks jamessan, that did the trick.
07ecb7d03dcbe76152d36fe37ecec0f6 (20:27): haha
ade2ba280c823b6462a992b994ecd802 (20:48): if you find a way to make it not painfully slow if you backspace a long variable name, tell me ;)
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:49): oeni: after the last CR add, <ESC>F{<CR>
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:50): I think that'd do it
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:50): oh wait, in insert mode
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:50): oeni: after the last CR add, <ESC>F{<CR>i
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:53): oh wait that won't work either
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:54): oeni: after the last CR add, <ESC>?{<CR>a
cc8f779200b7979930492b9c15de74f7 (20:55): webdragon - thank you!
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:55): I'm actually enamored of an alternate way of doing it
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:55): other than abbrs
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:55): lemme show ya
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:56): imap <leader>pre <pre><CR></pre><ESC>?><CR>a
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:56): something I use for html a lot
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:56): how to trigger it, is while in insert mode, I type \pre
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:57): so you could use, concievably, imap <leader>yf ...
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:57): and then trigger it with \yf
cc8f779200b7979930492b9c15de74f7 (20:57): mhmm... another way... think i have to play with that things a little bit!
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:58): got a bunch of things in this: www.webdragon.net/miscel/vimrc.web.txt
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (20:58): all different kinds including abbrs
79b5a6c625a690874528cc310af0f7ea (21:01): there's a bunch of other vim stuff linked on the html/css page there
cc8f779200b7979930492b9c15de74f7 (21:01): gnah... always the same. just working with vim doesn't do it - there's always new things to try out and a nice playground!
